page.title: 10TUBE STATIONS
page.content: Northwood and Northwood Hills are both on the Metropolitan tube line.From these two stations you have a choice of going North to Watford or South to Baker Street.It does not cost alot to travel on the train,for an adult to get to Baker Street it only costs Â£1.40.For a child it costs Â£0.40.To be eligible to pay a child fare you have to be under the age of 16 years.Every child under the age of 16 but over 13 must have a child rate card to prove they are under 16.the card has a small picture of the card holder which must be shown on request by the station official.Northwood and Northwood Hills stations have 2 platforms.one of them takes the trains to Watford,the other to Baker Street.The platforms are situated below street level,in many cases the train line has to go under the road.
